loc.data: These are private groups and those you are permitted to manage.
This manual was not yet published and hence can not be reviewed.
As an invited peer reviewer you can manage your reviews here. Other team members can read reviews and add comments.
You're about to reject a review permanently. Please confirm.
Manage all your marketing activity here and monitor the success of your activities
Optimize your sales and revenues by using our sophisticate analysis tools.
Find all your sales and income of the past time in this summary.
You're the lead author for {0}. You're a contributor for {1}.
Marketing Packages are global, they can be used in any project, but can be assigned only once.

These settings are predefinitions used to improve and accelerate the publishing process. You, however, change these settings any time and during the actual publishing procedure. Each of these settings have influence on the way your work become visible, makes money, and is spread through the community. The basic rule is that you get more attention, make more money, and have more success the less restricted your work is.
You're about to delete a Marketing Package permanently.
Common settings for '{0}'

The package {0} was created at {1}.
{2}.

You cannot change this packages settings because it is already assigned to another project. Choose project first and handle packages, then.

This project has no package. Select one from list below or create a new suitable one.

This page show your current revenues per time and per text.
This chart shows all sales of all projects made in the past 30 days.
Move mouse over segments to view details.
You can, once the manual has been created, remove, add, change, and edit milestones. You can assign milestones to contributors once a team has been established.
Blog Article, does contain a single article.
Copy the current content to the new issue. This is helpful for translation, editing, and new issues.
Milestones help managing the writing progress.

You can, once the manual has been created, remove, add, change, and edit milestones. You can assign milestones to contributors once a team has been established.

This is an internal name and not meant to be the published text's name

On this page you start a new manual within the project {0}. Modify settings according your needs.
You can, once the manual has been created, remove, add, change, and edit milestones. You can assign milestones to contributors once a team has been established.
As an author you can edit the whole text
This version has no active offsprings. It is the current issue.
As a designer you can create vector graphics
As an editor you can add private comments to your team manual snippet by manual snippet
Upload and manage files you wish to include or add as a download
As a proof reader you can add, change, or delete manual using a correction tool
As a reviewer you can write public reviews for published texts
Create semantic particles to help creating stringent content
Your are editing {0}. Choose the appropriate tool from the task pane at the right.
This text is part of project {0}.
The workspace {0} was created {1} at {2}
These properties manage the global matching of all Content. Authors can overwrite these settings on paragraph level.
These properties manage the publishing options for this particular text. While publishing all options can be set or changed as well.
You have the following roles assigned:
As a translator you can translate manual portions step by step using Bing or Google
The translation tool is activated for you. However, the current manual is not tagged as an active translation project. Options depend on your state.
Add as many descriptive elements as you like. Keywords shall have a relation to Content. All settings can be refined on chapter or section.
Only the leading author can change these values

You're currently working with manual {0}. The list below shows all milestones. You can change the state for those milestones you're currently responsible. As a team lead you can delegate the responsibilty to somebody else from your team.
You're about to remove a milestone permanently.

You can merge predefined boilerplates from any of your projects by moving first level elements (chapters) to the current text. This functions creates copies of the boilerplate and adds a relation to identify changes.
You can merge manual by moving first level elements (chapters) from one manual to another. Empty texts, where no content has been left, will become inactive.
There are no milestones assigned to this book project.

Each time an author sets a restore point a copy of the whole document has been created. Click on one of the restore points, the return to this very version. The current version will become a new restore point itself so you're safe against any changes made.
You can upload a backup made with the backup tool and replace the Content of the current manual with this.
Click message to close and try again.

This page shows all payments of all your projects. Find the total revenues and your share. See past, current, and future payments.
The balance shown here is the summary of all former transactions.
You have no Paypal-Id or payment method in your profile. Hence, we can't send you any money from your balance.
The table below shows all historical transactions in your account, beginning with the most recent.
If you have any money in our internal accounting system you can withdraw to the primary payment account. The primary account is set in your profile, e.g. a PayPal id.
How much amount you want to withdraw?

On this page you can see all projects you're administering.

If a project or work container does not appear here please check the following pre-conditions:
  • The project as well as the container must be active
  • The container's milestones, if any, must not contain any milestones not yet done
  • A marketing package must be assigned to the project and activated properly.
  • You must the owner or project lead to invoke production. Consider asking your admin.
If NOT checked the search goes only through your current team members.
You're about to assign the project to the selected user. This operation cannot be undone. Please confirm here: {0} assigning project {1}.

You can abandon you work as a lead for this particular project and assign it to another user. This has some consequences:

  • The new lead author will get all revenues
  • The new lead author will control your membership, if you decide to stay in the project as a contributor
  • All your texts, once published, appear under the name of the new lead author

The function is appropriate, if

  • You want to merge accounts you already own
  • You provide services for others, such as import of MS Word documents, and want to move the project forward
  • You decide to work with another account for a particular operation
  • You move content betwenn a private account and an account managed by an agency
Give the ownership of the whole project to another user. See help for details.
Keep myself in the team as a regular member. Uncheck if you're just a service provider.
Type the username to get suggestions. Use the search fields below for other search options.
You're about to assign the project to the selected user. This operation cannot be undone. Please confirm

As a lead, create and propose shares with your contributors. Define a base price for Content. Any production cost for distinct media will be added automatically. As a contributor, watch pricing and share proposals and confirm or deny.

These are previously deactivated projects. You can reactivate or delete finally. Deletion will remove the project, all containing texts, all related Content, resources, teams and teams' data from database.

You're the only member in the team.
Project {0}, active since {1}
You're about to delete a file.
This does not delete any content already imported into a project.

Import a Word File without any style checking apart from headers, sections, tables, and images. This is recommended to getas much content as possible into the project. After import use the integrated editor to refine semantic meanings.
The import will work only if you use the texxtoor MS® Word® Template. You can also use the MS® Word® Add-In for easy upload of text.
The file {0} was uploaded {1} at {2}. It has been converted to an importable HTML.
If everything is fine just create the project now and start publishing
{0} files have been processed. The importer has found {1} styles. {2} styles have been mapped already.

To upload HTML open Word, load your file, export to disk using the option 'Website, filtered'. This results in a *.htm file and a folder with the very same name that contains the image files. Create a ZIP-File of this and upload the zipped content here.

A complete Word project may appear in different ways. You can upload your work here like this:

  1. Create a single document
  2. Create a document per chapter (recommended)

It's strongly recommend to have all images in the document separately. For you convenience it's not necessary to change the local paths to the images in the document. Once an image is found the import processor looks it up in a subfolder 'Images'. If it can't be found there, it's looked up in 'Images/ChapterName'.
Embedded images are processed directly and without further folder management. However, due to the size of final Word file, we recommend uploading images separately.
If everything is fine just create the project now and start publishing
{0} files have been processed. The importer has found {1} styles. {2} styles have been mapped already.

To upload HTML open MS Word, load your file, export to disk using the option 'Website, filtered'. This results in a *.htm file and a folder with the very same name that contains the image files. Create a ZIP-File of this and upload the zipped content here.

A complete Word project may appear in different ways. You can upload your manual here like this:

  1. Create a single document
  2. Create a document per chapter (recommended)

It's strongly recommend to have all images in the document separately. For you convenience it's not necessary to change the local paths to the images in the document. Once an image is found the import processor looks it up in a subfolder 'Images'. If it can't be found there, it's looked up in 'Images/ChapterName'.
Embedded images are processed directly and without further folder management. However, due to the size of final Word file, we recommend uploading images separately.

Start working with your existing documents! Just upload one or more Microsoft Word files in DOCX format (Office 2007 or 2010) and map the styles used in the document with the semantic elements used by texxtoor.
2. Map the DOCX Styles to Functions
1. Manage Your Upload for {0} Here
Import MS Word with Complex Styles

Import a Word File without any style checking apart from headers, sections, tables, and images. This is recommended to get as much content as possible into the project. After import use the integrated editor to refine semantic meanings.
No Character Styles have been found in the import documents.
No Numbering Styles have been found in the import documents.
No Paragraph Styles have been found in the import documents.
The set of mappings is saved for further reference under the given name. Choose a name from list edit an existing set. Each mapping is stored as part of a single project.

Assign the appropriate settings to each of the styles found in your Word import. Click 'Assign Styles', than. The setting are stored as part of the project settings and you can repeat this procedure any time until the import satisfies your needs.

On this page you can see all projects you're associated with. As a lead-author you can edit the project details and initiate the publishing process. As a participant, such as a co-author or translator, you can view project settings and team members.

You start a new project any time. If you start a project you become a lead-author automatically. You can go further by just start typing or invite others to participate helping to create, style, and lay-out your project.
A project can contain a single text, multiple versions of a text, or even works as some sort of container for Content such blog articles. You can ran a team or do it yourself.
You're about to deactivate a project permanently. Please confirm.
Use this board to share anything outside the Content level with your team members. This board is specific to {0}.
Use this board to share anything outside the Content level with your team members. This board is specific to {0}.
Select the project you wish to add the manual to. Existing texts will preserved if they have same name.
Move the manual {0} to another project. This is useful if you start working in another author's team and want to provide your texts there.
Blog Article, does contain a single article.
You can, once the manual has been created, remove, add, change, and edit milestones. You can assign milestones to contributors once a team has been established.
When you create a new project, the first manual within will be created automatically. Please set the options for this very first manual below.

Shows the content of manual formatted in AtomPub as used for RSS in a window.
Click here to view the feed.
Settings to see your manual in Google Currents, on Facebook, on MySpace, and several other free promotion features.
Click on a button to download the document.
While the final production takes place once the reader requests a document, you have the ability to check the final appearance.

Thanks for publishing your text. Our mutual success to market, sell, and distribute depends the information given below to further support this text. The key is to understand what the reader community needs to adopt the text, using the "word of mouse" to let others know that a new sophisticated piece of knowledge has been born.

The core function of our platform is the distribution of content. We strongly recommend to enhance your audience and find new markets by giving other authors access to your content. Be proud of being copied! Copy is not a bad word—it's the best and fastest way to make money. As the lead author you can easily increase your revenues by just opening this text.
Use this HTML code to embed a quick order ad into your website or blog.
For more information about how to create support pages visit these links:

Create a new version (instance) of your currently published manual and re-publish under a new name, version and declare the relation. The relation to the previous manual shall be an improvement, addition, or so. You can work on the text, then, and re-publish using the update function at any time later.
Click on the image to upload another one
Add your data you want to use for publishing outside of texxtoor. These information will become visible publicly.
You can publish under your own label or as texxtoor. Create a label here you can choose later while publishing.
Upload ISBN if you want to use your own ones and manage already processed numbers here.
Using custom ISBN may prevent us from tracking your revenues. Please assure that you pay your contributors according the team settings by yourself.
Paste all your ISBNs in here, line by line. Format is ISBN 13 (13 digits per line)
These are all recent publishing procedures.

On the following page you can collect the content from workrooms, change title, subtitle, cover, and how the authors appear. Addtionally, you can modifiy the marketing settings, add a homepage, blog, or wiki to this title. For social network support you can adda Facebook or MySpace page, or send messages to some other social network sites.

You're about publishing a text. Once published the manual will be made available immediately to the public according your marketing settings. Subsequent marketing action start after being published. The publish workflow may take some time and you can watch progress and success any time from here
Work {0}, created at {1}.

The default option creates allows you to create and market your manual actively at major stores, such as Kindle, Apple iBook, or in print. You may charge for this and configure an ISBN for public catalogues. The manual will always appear on texxtoor. The 'Quick Publish' option (check box) makes your content publicly available as an RSS feed. You cannot charge for this. It will not appear in the catalog but is still available through the Matrix search and, if permitted, for other authors.

This project does not yet contain any publishable books. A manual is publishable, if:
  • All contributors confirmed the shares or payments
  • All defined milestones are done
  • The manual remains active
This is the first publishing. Select and proceed with options.
You cannot publish any texts because you don't have provided a valid address in your profile (My Data). This is necessary to create a contract and handle your royalties.
Please select a project you wish to publish a manual from.
However, we found some texts that have issues you need to resolve before publish them:
There are no publishable manual in this project.
manual {0}, created at {1}.
This is the first publishing. Select and proceed with options.
There are no published texts from this project.
The manual {0} was not yet finally published. A publish procedure has been created already.
The manual {0} was published at {1} under the title {2} ({3}).

Include contributors in the list of authors
Include these contributor's biography in the 'about the authors' section
Click below to start the publishing procedure according the setup shown here.
Manage the appearance in eBook shops here
Resources available in the source project
Choose an appropriate template for printing. The EPUB template is choosen automatically to match the print choice.
Choose an appropriate template for {0} output. This template will be used for production.
Use these options to generate the cover:
Apply these options to control production:

With these options you can design your own cover. While creating the content we add title, subtitle, and names of authors automatically. You can only set the front cover, the back cover is part of the template and we create this on-thy-fly. If you upload your own cover it's required to have spaces for title, subtitle, and authors. Click 'Create Cover' to preview the placement and correct your image accordingly.
The cover must have 1748 x 2452 pixel to fit to the printing process. Shrinked versions for apps will be created automatically.
Click on one of the entries to remove from selection.
Manage the appearance in eBook shops here
Resources are a convenient way to provide additional data to your users. After publishing you get a unique support page for each published manual that allows users the access to the provided files.
Marketing package {0} has been selected.

Use this form to describe your manual as good as possible. After publishing is done we create an electronic manual immediately. User will see the manual in the public catalogues and can order your text.
Specify how this manual will appear in catalogues.
These setting apply to all target platforms.
We publish your manual worldwide. A selection of shops appears below. Please fill in the fields carfully to publish successfully.
(eBook-Shops world wide, including Amazon and Apple, fees may apply)
There are no catalogue entries assigned yet.
Select your own imprint to publish with own ISBNs.
Select the targets for this publication. This changes the availability of options on the next steps.
Resources available in the source project
Include contributors in the list of authors
Confirm the procedure. This is the final step and makes your manual available immediately.

Before you finally publish a manual you need to read, understand, and sign the author's contractbetween you and our platform. Please open the link below, read the text, and confirm by tickingthe checkbox at the end.
Include these contributor's biography in the 'about the authors' section
Fill in and confirm all the previous forms before finishing the publish procedure.
Click below to start the publishing procedure according the setup shown here.
This is not in a frozen state and reflects your current text. It is NOT accessible from other accounts but yours.
To watch your growing manual while not publishing, use the temporary link below.
This is the permanent link to the published work:
You can even check the state of the project on production side using this link:
Your article {0} has been made available to the public as HTML and RSS feed.
The link below is a private feed you can use to check it out on your favorite feed reader.
These are recently published projects. Re-publish or finish publishing procedures.
You change these settings at any time. However, printed copies and published work on foreign platforms will not update. The update refreshes the content source database on texxtoor only.
You cannot change these settings for an intermediate update release

You have decided to update a currently published work. As we guarantee both, a stable access to data (frozen state) and up-to-data content, some decisions are required. Fill in the form below and proceed with the publishing procedure.
You cannot upload files here. To import use the 'Import Word' function. Imported files appear here for reference purpose.
You cannot upload files here. The trash bin holds files deleted on other tabs.

Content: This container stores all stuff needed to be embedded into the content. All files here are dirtectly accessible to the authors and they are able to add them in any of the active Opus' of the project
Import: Store all files and resources you wish to import from here. Typically these are MS Word files and images.

Project: The project container stores all files that support the team members. There are no restrictions using these folders, but authors cannot access these files from editor to include the stuff in publishable content. To make drafts created here finally available in the project's output, move or copy the file to the Content container.
On this page you can manage all files and logical resources you and your team needs to create the books of the project {0}.
Emptying trashes removes files physically. This cannot be undone. Function applies to all items.
Hint: Rename files and replace the file name with a figure caption. The caption will be applied when you insert the figure into your text.
Trash: The trash container stores all files no longer needed.
The termset is a public global termset. Changes may apply to many projects.
You cannot delete the private global list.
The termset {0} was created at {1}. {2}.
The termset is a public global termset. Changes may apply to many projects.

Use abbreviations to write faster and create more compact text. In interactive texts abbrevations can by expanded by the user dynamically. Text appears in the document, content is the non-abbreviated value visible on request.
Manage your citation manual here. Readers can create a bibliography from these information if needed.
Definitions help readers to dig deeper into a subject. In interactive manual definitions appear as popup once the term has been tapped or clicked.
Idioms are variations, such as a dialect, and used to express a semantic meaning. Explain why the marked word is an idiom.
Variables are being replaced by the time of creation with dynamic data. For example, "UserName" is replaced with the reader's name in the final product. Use this to make texts more personal.
Manage links, either internal or external ones here. Links become interactive in electronic publications. Use check functions to assure your links are properly working.
You're about to delete a termset permanently.
From list above select choose a termset and click 'Manage Terms'.
Manage abbreviations, cites, definitions, idioms, variables and common links in one place. Organize all sort of terms in termsets to have them handy while writing.
Changes apply to termsets related to project {0}.
Manage the content of the selected termset.
See your performance and reputation on the platform. Most activities get points and increase your level. Some functions are available to higher levels only.
Each author will get a welcome package, that helps to get started immediately. It's free and easy to use.
texxtoor provides many ways to increase quality, help authors to create sophisticated works and make them succeed.
We're dedicated to quality. To assure high level output an advanced reputation system has been established. That's not meant to limit you, we're here to help.
This is your own text. You cannot unfreeze yourself.
manual {0}, created at {1}.
This is the first publishing. Select and proceed with options.
Leave empty to make work available in all supported countries. Otherwise add countries one by one.
Content is available without any charge on the platform. You can still sell printed copies.
Content is available without any charge on the platform. You can still sell printed copies.
Content is available without any charge on the platform. Printed copies can have ads.
User can buy based on the pricing below. This is 'your price'. Production cost will add.
If a subscription is available this publication will participate
A custom level with more specific settings defined while publishing
Does not participate in any sales model (other options may not apply)
Regular sale on a 'per piece' base
If acceptable, please specify range for the hourly rates:
Add new contributors to the team {0} for specific roles. Users without contribution roles are not being searchable.
All members in the box below are being added to the team. Enter names directly to ignore search terms.
Click search to see any results.
If you contribute on a hourly base (time and material) or for fixed salery and just finished your milestone, you can now raise an invoice to your team's lead author
This sheet shows all outstanding payments, both due or not due.
Currently we support one position per invoice only. For multiple position, raise multiple invoices.
Currently there are no invoices in this list.
In this dialog you can manage your invoices and send new one to your lead author.
You're about to delete an invoice permanently.
In this dialog you can manage your invoices and send new one to your lead author.
You're about to delete an invoice permanently.

You have been invited to contribute to a project. Within the team the lead author settles the conditions. The data shown below are the proposal for you. You can either confirm this to start working immediately. Or you can enter different values and return the proposal to the lead author. If you return the lead author will get an email with your suggestions and you'll be removed from team. The lead author decides to add you with new conditions or not.
Find below all pending proposals for {0}. There is one proposal for each book the team {1} works on.
There is nothing to confirm. Your membership has been confirmed or you have been removed.
Proposal is {1} {0}

Author and contributors can negotiate a share. If the author pays the contributors a fixed or hourly salary it is not necessary to share the revenues. Contributors must confirm the share before the project becomes publishable.
Each project can contain one or more texts (work). The team members can get distinct shares for each of these texts.

Members with role author can manage the project, including changing members, publish. Members with role contributor can work on content only.

These are private groups and those you are permitted to manage.

Private groups can share texts online—if one member buys a manual online all members will have access to it. Members can share bookmarks, comments, and related resources. Members can send private messages directly to each other. Uploaded content by members will be accessible be all others. All activities within the group are kept private to members.

A private manual contains content you can work with, order as a printed copy, or for reading on tablet device. You can use it to add bookmarks, comments, or share it with your team, fellow pupils, or co-workers. You can add content directly from our catalog, completely or in parts. To work with parts of content check the 'My Content' function where content is stored in convenient collections.

The rating system consists of two parts. First, the direct user input counts 50%. Each start given provides ten points. Second, the actual activities around the content provide the other 50%. Activities like reading, order as an app, or even re-use content from other authors give more points. There is also a deduction procedure. After some time of missing activity the points get reduced.

Apart from common business profil data you can use to present yourself you can create a single public profile here. texxtoor takes this an opportunity to make you visible to your friends exactly as you like. This is totally volontary and and can stay empty.

The profile manual shown below is a template that gives a hint how to create a sophisticated profile. Consider changing the manual first and save, then. Unless saved for the very first time the wall manual remains empty.
Public Profile for {0}
We provide extensive help for authors.
The easist way to start with texxtoor is the texxtoor Word Add-In. This consists of template with few styles and the ability to check the document for consistency and upload to your project.
This is the contract which regulates the relation between each author and the platform.
No keywords! Start with adding one, it's so easy.

To start using texxtoor there are a few simple steps, that make your life easier:
  1. Download the Author Package – see below
  2. Install the MS Word-AddIn. If not possible just use the texxtoor.dotx template
  3. Write your text, upload figures using the add-in
  4. Create a project
  5. Upload your manual to that project
  6. Go to the text's dashboard, go to 'Edit text'
  7. Check out that the uploaded manual is properly set and formatted in the editor 'Tasks' > 'Editor'
  8. If done use the 'Author Preview' to see that everything well layed out
  9. Set a marketing package to have the major settings handy
  10. Publish the text, set template, cover, and all catalog data
  11. Watch your manual in the reader
  12. Order your author copies for a discounted price
